channel.title: Do a Backflip on a Trampoline
channel.description:
Have you ever wanted to be able to do a backflip on a trampoline? I found this the other day from [url=http://www.wikihow.com/Do-a-Backflip-on-a-Trampoline]here[/url] and would like to share it with all of you. [b]Warning[/b]: Do [b]not[/b] do this if you have neck pain or any injuries. Also [b]make[/b] sure you try it in the center of the trampoline so you don't fall off.
Steps
1. Find a trampoline and get to know simple tricks, mainly a back drop. 2. Try to bounce as high as you can, because a beginner will need a lot of air for this trick. 3. Right as you reach the peak height of your jump, do a pelvic thrust, kick of both of your feet forward as hard as you can, and throw your head back. 4. Keep your eyes open so you can look at the ground as soon as possible, when you are almost done flipping. 5. Tuck your feet in to get a little extra boost around the flip. 6. Land by planting your feet.
Tips
* It varies on how long it takes for someone to learn this, so be patient. * Most of it is a mental barrier, so if you think you can do it and you are not scared, then you should be able to do it within a week. * Make sure you flip at the peak of your jump, not right near the mat. * If you want to plant your landing, bend your knees so they can take some of the impact * If you want to keep jumping(do more tricks) keep your legs stiff, so the trampolie gets the energy.
Have fun, Leader

item.title: Do a Backflip on a Trampoline
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“XharveyX, post:22, topic:12354”]1. Start doing back drops
2. Jump your highest
3. When u reach your highest, tuck your legs and try reach your heels with the back of your head.[/quote]
Or jump in the rain and wait for nature to teach you.

Slip.

Read full topic
item.source: Do a Backflip on a Trampoline

  2. Jump your highest
  3. When u reach your highest, tuck your legs and try reach your heels with the back of your head.

item.title: Do a Backflip on a Trampoline
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

taught myself when i was 7. Recently taught myself a 360 backflip.

I remember teaching my sister to do a backflip, then after lunch she started crying because she forgot -.-.

EDIT: didnt realize this was bumped. Damn the unread topics button.

item.title: Do a Backflip on a Trampoline
item.dc:creator: @maniown maniown
item.description:
@maniown wrote:

[quote=“Cheesehunk, post:10, topic:12354”]I can do backfilps simple, way easier than front flips. Infact, I can do Backflips 360’s.

I have to say though, I am dissapointed in this guide When I was a beginner, theere was no way I was thrusting myself backwards like that (For fear of broken neck.) I learnt by doing backwords Karthwheels, then I turned them into Back handspings. Then I went back to Karthwheels, and started to removed a hand, or two. Eventually, I straigtened them up, and now I cna do perfect Backflips! :)[/quote] first off thats called a full not a backflip 360 and yeah i can do double fronts finnaly took me like 2 weeks to get the guts to get around for the 2nd rotation =D

Read full topic
item.source: Do a Backflip on a Trampoline

item.title: Do a Backflip on a Trampoline
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

phonnygoblin:

facing foreward or backward? cause if u can backflip facing foreward u kick ass

Forward of course. Backflips are way easier than frontflips once you have them down, you can spot your ladning so much easier. I can also do a Backflip, and move forward on a trampoline. Also, I can do a single bounce Backflip, and Flair(Back flip 180.)

Read full topic

item.title: Do a Backflip on a Trampoline
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

I can do backfilps simple, way easier than front flips. Infact, I can do Backflips 360’s.

I have to say though, I am dissapointed in this guide When I was a beginner, theere was no way I was thrusting myself backwards like that (For fear of broken neck.) I learnt by doing backwords Karthwheels, then I turned them into Back handspings. Then I went back to Karthwheels, and started to removed a hand, or two. Eventually, I straigtened them up, and now I cna do perfect Backflips!

Read full topic

item.title: Do a Backflip on a Trampoline
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

Have you ever wanted to be able to do a backflip on a trampoline? I found this the other day from here and would like to share it with all of you. Warning: Do not do this if you have neck pain or any injuries. Also make sure you try it in the center of the trampoline so you don’t fall off.

Steps

  1. Find a trampoline and get to know simple tricks, mainly a back drop.
  2. Try to bounce as high as you can, because a beginner will need a lot of air for this trick.
  3. Right as you reach the peak height of your jump, do a pelvic thrust, kick of both of your feet forward as hard as you can, and throw your head back.
  4. Keep your eyes open so you can look at the ground as soon as possible, when you are almost done flipping.
  5. Tuck your feet in to get a little extra boost around the flip.
  6. Land by planting your feet.

Tips

* It varies on how long it takes for someone to learn this, so be patient.
* Most of it is a mental barrier, so if you think you can do it and you are not scared, then you should  be able to do it within a week. 
* Make sure you flip at the peak of your jump, not right near the mat.
* If you want to plant your landing, bend your knees so they can take some of the impact
* If you want to keep jumping(do more tricks) keep your legs stiff, so the trampolie gets the energy.

Have fun,
Leader

Read full topic
